# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia code for this task. This function uses the built-in DateFormat and Dates libraries to extract year and month from DateTime type data, then concatenate them together as a string:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> format(x, "yyyymm"), df.dt)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym` to it. The values in this new column are derived from the original DateTime column `:dt`.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now() + Month(i) for i in 1:5])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a DataFrame `df` with DateTime column `:dt`, and then add a new column `:ym` to it. The values of the `:ym` column are strings representing the year and month of the corresponding date in the `:dt` column, in the format "yyyymm".
